2 Ways to Print WhatsApp Messages from iPhone/Android

natalie

July 7, 2020. Filed to: WhatsApp

2 min read

It is possible to have important WhatsApp chats that you want to print out for posterity’s sake. This is especially true when you use WhatsApp for business purposes and you have a lot of messages with important information in them. In this case, you need to first export the conversations from your WhatsApp account and print then out.

If you are looking for ways to do that, this article will prove very useful to you. In it, we are going to share with you the various ways you can print WhatsApp messages.

  • 1. Export WhatsApp Messages via Email and Print Then Out
  • 2. Directly Export WhatsApp Data to PC for Printing

1. Export WhatsApp Messages via Email and Print Then Out

Since there is no “Print” button within WhatsApp, you need a way to export the chats you want to print and then print them out. One of the best ways to do that on Android is via email. Follow these simple steps to do it:

Step 1: Open WhatsApp on your device and then go to “Contacts”. Tap on the Menu button and then select “Settings”. Tap on “Chats and Calls > Chat History”.

Step 2: Select “Email Chat” and then select the chats that you would like to print from the list. As soon as you select the chats, you will see a popup asking you if you would like to “Attach Media” or print “Without Media.

Step 3: Enter the email account that you want to export the chats to.

Step 4: Now sign in to that email account and open the email to download the attached messages (they will be in TXT format).You can then easily just print them out using any printer attached to your device.

For iPhone:

You can also just as easily export the messages via email on your iPhone. To do that, just follow these simple steps:

Step 1: Open WhatsApp on your device and then go to “Settings”.

Step 2: Open Chat Settings and then tap on “Email Conversation”.

Step 3: Choose the chats that you would like to export for printing and then choose whether you would like to “Attach Media” or export them “Without Media”.

Step 4: Enter the email address you would like to send the messages to and then tap “Send”.

Step 5: You can then open the email and download the attached WhatsApp chats in TXT format to print them out.

2. Directly Export WhatsApp Data to PC for Printing

Perhaps the best way to print out WhatsApp chats from any device is to export the messages to your PC and then print them out. To do this however, you need a third-party tool that will work as a go-between, allowing you to easily export the messages from the device to the PC. The best tool for this job is Mobitrix WhatsApp Transfer. That’s because this program can be used to create a backup of all the chats on your Android or iPhone and then you can easily access them and print them from the PC.

Mobitrix is also useful when you want to transfer WhatsApp chats from one device to another even if the devices run on different platforms. The following is how to use it to export WhatsApp chats to your PC for printing:

Step 1: Download and install Mobitrix WhatsApp transfer to your computer. Open the program and then connect the device to the computer using USB cables. You may need to unlock the iPhone or enable USB debugging on your Android device to allow the program to detect the device.

Step 2: Now, click on “Back up WhatsApp on Devices” on the left and as soon as you are certain that the program detects the connected device, click on “Back Up”.

Step 3: When the backup is complete, disconnect the device from the computer and then click on “Export/Restore WhatsApp Backup” from the left. Select the backup that you’ve just created and then click “Export to Computer”.

Step 4: The program will analyze the data in the selected folder. Once the analysis is done, you can choose the file location and the output format for the exported chats at the bottom of the page. We recommend choosing “HTML” format to make it easy to print the files.

Step 5: When the export process is complete, you can simply open the HTML file on any browser on your computer and then hit “Ctrl +P” to print the messages.

The solutions above will prove useful to you whenever you want to print your WhatsApp chats. If you have relatively fewer messages to print out, the best way to do is to export the chats to Email as we have seen in method one and two above. But if you want to print a large number of chats, exporting them to HTML using Mobitrix is the best option.
